div.p: Why you write nothing, I am very surprised, especially in such a difficult state of affairs.

I was calm and completely assured, promising myself all good things from the upcoming assembly, and therefore today, when I go out for a walk, many people approach, inquire if I have any news, inform me what has been written by the council of Zürich, what from elsewhere, and that tomorrow there will be an assembly here. It is the custom that the bishop announces it in the God's House, which gives him a council at hand. However, he refused and wanted only to summon the nearest ones, namely the papists; but when he hesitated, our council gave him the option, either he would write or they would write for him, and therefore the bishop, seeing the matter was serious, finally wrote, although very unwillingly. A young man from Höuwen writes to the one from Marmols: he hears that a confederation does not stand well together; it is very regrettable to him.
